Analyst

class MFPipeline.analyst.event_analyst.EventAnalyst(event_name, analyst_path, config_dict=None, config_path=None)

This is a class that analyzes one event. It takes care of other sub-analysts that fit microlensing models to the light curve, create colour-magnitude diagrams and perform other additional tasks.

An Event Analyst needs either a config_path or config_dict, otherwise it will not work.

Parameters:

  • event_name – str, name of the analyzed event

  • analyst_path – str, path to the folder where the outputs are saved

  • config_dict – dictionary, optional, dictionary with Event Analyst configuration

  • config_path – str, optional, path to the YAML configuration file of the Event Analyst

parse_config(config_path)

Parse YAML file with configuration and turn it into a dictionary.

Parameters:

config_path – str, path with YAML file containing Event Analyst configuration.

Returns:

dictionary with Event Analyst configuration

run_cmd_analyst()

Launch CMD Analyst to create a CMD plot for all soultions and specified catalogues.

Returns:

a list of boolean values corresponding to satuts of the created cmd plots.

run_single_analyst()

Perform tasks assigned to a single Event Analyst. First the event is handeled by a Fit Analyst, searching for fitting microlensing models. After fitting is done, output information is passed to a CMD Analyst, that creates a CMD plot for specified catalogs and plots the source and blend for each found solution.

Returns:

status?

class MFPipeline.analyst.cmd_analyst.CmdAnalyst(path_outputs, event_name, ra, dec, catalogue_name, light_curve_data, optional=None, radius=0.5, file_path=None)

analyst handling a single CMD.

load_catalogue_data()

Based on the catalogue name, select sources within radius. :return: array with data to create a cmd plus labels

load_catalogue_from_file_data(separator=',')

Load a file with information needed for a CMD :return: data and labels of the CMD background

plot_cmd(source_data, source_labels, cmd_data, cmd_labels)

Create a CMD. :param source_data: pandas dataframe with light curve information :param source_labels: labels of filters in the source_data :param cmd_data: pandas dataframe with cmd background information from survey :param cmd_labels: labels of filters in the cmd_data :return: status of creating a cmd plot

plot_gaia_cmd(source_data, source_labels, cmd_data, cmd_labels)

Plot a Gaia CMD. :param source_data: data frame with Gaia data :param source_labels: labels of filters in the source_data :param cmd_data: pandas dataframe with cmd background information from Gaia :param cmd_labels: labels of filters in the cmd_data :return: status of creating a cmd plot

transform_source_data()
Returns:

transform_source_gaia_data()

Transforms a dictionary passed by the user to dataframe holding information from the light curve. :return: returns a pandas dataframe with rows of object and its magnitudes in passed filters
